title: Compile common voice dictation word replacements list
description:
Build a reference list of words commonly misrecognized or replaced in voice dictation with Talon.

Key discovery: talonhub/community has a built-in system for this:
- settings/words_to_replace.csv — CSV file (auto-created on first run) where users map misrecognized words to correct ones. Format: target word first, spoken/misheard word second.
- core/vocabulary/vocabulary.py — PhraseReplacer class that powers the substitution system. Also handles capitalization defaults (months, etc.) and custom vocabulary.
- Users can add replacements by voice: 'copy to replacements as <phrase>' (edit_vocabulary.talon)
- The file is per-user (in settings/ dir, gitignored by most people)

Idea: Aggregate words_to_replace.csv files from:
1. Notable personal configs in the awesome list (andreas-talon, colton_talon, etc.)
2. Community Slack discussions about common misrecognitions
3. The homophones.csv file (core/homophones/homophones.csv)

Possible outputs:
- A crowdsourced 'common replacements' reference on the website
- A starter words_to_replace.csv that new users can drop in
- Searchable dataset showing which words are most commonly confused

Example: 'crash mark' → 'question mark' (speech engine substitution)
